summary: This document is an email chain from August 12, 2019, discussing urgent plans to interview staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) following Jeffrey Epstein's death. It includes a list of 10 MCC personnel to be interviewed, with instructions to Mirandize them and provide 1001 warnings. The emails also mention interviewing the psychologist who took Epstein off suicide watch.

events.title: Planning interviews of MCC staff
events.description: Urgent coordination via email to interview Metropolitan Correctional Center personnel, including the Warden and a psychologist, following Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.description: A list of 10 MCC staff members (with roles like duty officers and shift supervisors) was compiled for urgent interviews, to be Mirandized and given 1001 warnings.

events.title: Epstein taken off suicide watch
events.description: A psychologist took Jeffrey Epstein off suicide watch prior to his death, prompting a planned interview by investigators.

locations: Office of the Inspector General, 1 Battery Park Plaza, 29th floor, New York, NY 10004
Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) (implied as the facility where Epstein died and staff worked)
keyFacts: The emails show urgent, coordinated planning on August 12, 2019, to interview MCC staff following Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
A specific list of 10 MCC personnel (with roles like duty officers and shift supervisors) was identified for interview, indicating a broad internal investigation.
Instructions were given to Mirandize the interviewees and provide 1001 warnings (related to false statements), suggesting a criminal investigation into potential wrongdoing.
A key interview target was the psychologist who took Epstein off suicide watch, highlighting this as a critical investigative focus.
The document reveals immediate post-death investigative actions by the FBI and prosecutors, focusing on prison staff and procedures.
